connector.description: Perform operations on Hazelcast distributed set.

camel.sink.endpoint.defaultOperation.name: camel.sink.endpoint.defaultOperation
camel.sink.endpoint.defaultOperation.description: To specify a default operation to use, if no operation header has been provided. One of: [put] [delete] [get] [update] [query] [getAll] [clear] [putIfAbsent] [allAll] [removeAll] [retainAll] [evict] [evictAll] [valueCount] [containsKey] [containsValue] [keySet] [removevalue] [increment] [decrement] [setvalue] [destroy] [compareAndSet] [getAndAdd] [add] [offer] [peek] [poll] [remainingCapacity] [drainTo] [removeIf] [take] [publish] [readOnceHeal] [readOnceTail] [capacity]

camel.sink.endpoint.hazelcastInstance.name: camel.sink.endpoint.hazelcastInstance
camel.sink.endpoint.hazelcastInstance.description: The hazelcast instance reference which can be used for hazelcast endpoint.

camel.sink.endpoint.hazelcastInstanceNam.name: camel.sink.endpoint.hazelcastInstanceName
camel.sink.endpoint.hazelcastInstanceNam.description: The hazelcast instance reference name which can be used for hazelcast endpoint. If you don't specify the instance reference, camel use the default hazelcast instance from the camel-hazelcast instance.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.hazelcast-set.lazyStartP.name: camel.component.hazelcast-set.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.hazelcast-set.lazyStartP.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.hazelcast-set.basicPrope.name: camel.component.hazelcast-set.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.hazelcast-set.basicPrope.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.component.hazelcast-set.hazelcastI.name: camel.component.hazelcast-set.hazelcastInstance
camel.component.hazelcast-set.hazelcastI.description: The hazelcast instance reference which can be used for hazelcast endpoint. If you don't specify the instance reference, camel use the default hazelcast instance from the camel-hazelcast instance.

camel.component.hazelcast-set.hazelcastM.name: camel.component.hazelcast-set.hazelcastMode
camel.component.hazelcast-set.hazelcastM.description: The hazelcast mode reference which kind of instance should be used. If you don't specify the mode, then the node mode will be the default.
